tags: spiritual

quote: Of the things that followed I cannot say at all whether they were what men call dream. And for all I can tell, the only difference is that what many see we call a real thing, and what only one sees we call a dream. But things that many see may have no taste or moment in them at all, and things that are shown only to one may be spears and water-spouts of truth from the very depth of truth.
author: C.S. Lewis, Till We Have Faces
tags: spiritual

quote: I could mend my soul no more than my face. Unless the gods helped. And why did the gods not help?
author: C.S. Lewis, Till We Have Faces
tags: spiritual

quote: We want cattle who can finally become food; He wants servants who can finally become sons. We want to suck in, He wants to give out. We are empty and would be filled; He is full and flows over. Our war aim is a world in which Our Father Below has drawn all other beings into himself: the Enemy wants a world full of beings united to Him but still distinct.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Screwtape Letters
tags: spiritual

quote: The Right Knowledge reduces pain-and-suffering, and increases happiness. If we fall short of having acquired the Right Knowledge, the faults is ours’, isn’t it?
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: fault, happiness, happy, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, mistake, pain, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, suffering

quote: Seeing the faults of others is indeed an echo of our own fault
author: the biggest fault is our own fault. That is known as the mad ego.
tags: Dada Bhagwan

quote: How can they meet us face to face till we have faces?
author: C.S. Lewis, Till We Have Faces
tags: spiritual

quote: One cannot see one’s own mistakes in matters where his interest lies.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: fault, mistake, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Are the gods not just?' 'Oh no, child. What would become of us if they were?
author: C.S. Lewis, Till We Have Faces
tags: spiritual

quote: It is the gods who have been accused. They have answered her. If they in turn accuse her, a greater judge and a more excellent court must try the case.
author: C.S. Lewis, Till We Have Faces
tags: spiritual

quote: You're a tree in whose shadow we can't thrive. We want to be our own.
author: C.S. Lewis, Till We Have Faces
tags: spiritual

quote: We'd rather they were ours and dead than yours and made immortal.
author: C.S. Lewis, Till We Have Faces
tags: spiritual

quote: If one is destined to go wrong, he will not believe the truth but will believe something else altogether.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: destiny, kismat, luck, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Once you have made the world an end, and faith a means, you have almost won your man, and it makes very little difference what kind of worldly end he is pursuing.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Screwtape Letters
tags: spiritual

quote: He cannot ravish. He can only woo.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Screwtape Letters
tags: spiritual

quote: We want the Church to be small not only that fewer men may know the Enemy but also that those who do may acquire the uneasy intensity and the defensive self-righteousness of a secret society or a clique.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Screwtape Letters
tags: spiritual

quote: Some ages are lukewarm and complacent, and then it is our business to soothe them yet faster asleep. Other ages, of which the present is one, are unbalanced and prone to faction, and it is our business to inflame them.
author: C.S. Lewis
tags: spiritual

quote: Never forget that when we are dealing with any pleasure in its healthy and normal and satisfying form, we are, in a sense, on the Enemy's ground...All the same, it is His invention, not ours...All we can do is to encourage the humans to take the pleasures which our Enemy has produced, at times, or in ways, or in degrees, which He has forbidden...An ever increasing craving for an ever diminishing pleasure is the formula.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Screwtape Letters
tags: spiritual

quote: As long as he does not convert it into action, it does not matter how much he thinks about this new repentance.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Screwtape Letters
tags: spiritual

quote: The Enemy wants him, in the end, to be so free from any bias in his own favour that he can rejoice in his own talents as frankly and gratefully as in his neighbour's talents--or in a sunrise, an elephant, or a waterfall.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Screwtape Letters
tags: spiritual

quote: Keep your opinion to yourself unless it’s asked for.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: consciousness, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, mindfulness, non-judgment, opinion, opinions-of-others, psychology, relationships, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: The science of the spirit and its relationship to the body in which it indwells is a complex conundrum. Life is not what it appears to be. Life is wholesome, and this unison of synergistic amalgamations persuade the common view that one thing is the other. But one thing is many things - at the one time - and this simple truth goes to the essence of all life with its manifold complexities.
author: Gabriel Brunsdon
tags: body, flesh, life, mystery, spirit, spiritual

quote: He who does propaganda for something will become famous about it, and if he remains incognito about it, he will become renowned. The value is for the renowned state and not for that of a famous state.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: famous, renowned, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Your judgments about another person say more about your own character than the character of the person you’re pointing a finger at.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: acceptance, consciousness, gay-pride, growth, inner-beauty, inner-peace, inspirational, judgment, psychology, self-improvement, spiritual, tolerance, understanding, understanding-oneself-and-others, unity, wisdom, zen

quote: I invite each of you to let go of your fears for just one day and say YES to life… say YES to love… say YES to You! You can always go back to saying ‘no’ another day.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: acceptance, acceptance-of-oneself, consciousness, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, love, psychology, releasing, releasing-fear, releasing-the-past, self-esteem, self-love, spiritual, wisdom, yes, zen

quote: Dare to be vulnerable, walk outside without your armor on and say YES to your heart.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: consciousness, growth, healing, healing-the-past, heart, inner-peace, inspirational, love, psychology, self-love, spiritual, vulnerability, wisdom, yes, zen

quote: This world is not at fault, the world is beautiful. If your understanding is wrong, what can the world do?
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: fault, faultless, flawless, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Pity moment, blah! Let’s turn it around! We do not even need to go into the story of it. We acknowledge this moment and release it. We love and accept and forgive ourselves. And we acknowledge that this is a tiny stitch, a brief pinprick in the needlepoints we are creating of our lives. And we also acknowledge that this lifetime of ours is but a tiny little stitch in the ever-expanding, infinite needlepoint of the Universe. Self-pity is not a reason good enough for us to be out of alignment with peace.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: consciousness, forgiveness, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, needlework, peace, psychology, release, self-actualization, self-help, self-improvement, spiritual, universe, wisdom, zen

quote: If there is wrong [ill] on the inside, the outside will appear wrong. Therefore, you should inquire within ‘why am I bothered, when others are not? So there must be wrong within me only.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: know-yourself, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, self-realisation, self-realised, self-realization, self-realized, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, who-am-i

quote: As long as this belief, ‘I am the doer’ is not gone, one has not yet attained an iota of exact religion. He is still in the auspicious-inauspicious [shubh-ashubh] state.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ashubh, belief, dharm, dharma, ego, religion, shubh, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, who-am-i

quote: If one takes responsibility for the mistakes, he is the true person, isn’t it? Do not insist. Instead of insisting, instead of blaming others, take the responsibility of the mistakes on your head!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: insist, insists, mistake, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Religion [dharma] originates where there is doer-ship [to do], Moksha [ultimate liberation] originates where there is understanding (to understand).
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: dharm, dharma, liberation, moksh, moksha, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What never happened will never change."(from "Oh, Leonardo")
author: Adele Kenny, A Lightness, a Thirst, or Nothing at All: Poems
tags: adele-kenny, inspirational, spiritual

quote: That which frees one from bondage is the right religion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: dharma, free-from-bondage, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Why should I care?’ – The one who says this is the greatest offender of nature.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The one who straightens out himself will attain moksha [will be liberated]. If you don’t straighten out, people will beat you into doing so. The doorway to moksha [ultimate liberation] is narrow, so how will you be able to enter if you are obstinate?
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: liberation, moksh, moksha, obstinate, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There is no insistence where there is pure love. Insistence is infatuation (deep attachment).
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: attachment, insistence, love, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Energies are to be expressed precisely with the person you don’t get along with. The energies are already there in dealing with the person you do get along with. ‘Not being able to get along’ is a weakness.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: energies, energy, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, weakness

quote: I am unable to tolerate’
author: to say this is the lack of ability to tolerate and ‘I am able to tolerate’ is itself the ability to tolerate.
tags: Dada Bhagwan

quote: The person who tolerates ‘exactly’ (with understanding) hands over his ‘case’ to nature. There is no need to punish anyone. Nature itself will punish him.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tolerance, tolerate

quote: Tolerance is an attribute of egoism.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, egoism, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tolerance

quote: Love it will not betray you, dismay or enslave you. It will set your free.
author: Mumford and Sons, Sigh No More
tags: love, romance, song, spiritual

quote: Don't you worry child see heaven's got a plan for you
author: Swedish House Mafia
tags: future, god, hapiness, heaven, song, spiritual

quote: To know worldly relations as being ‘relation’ (temporary) will resolve everything. However, if they are believed to be true (real) relations, there will be insistence. In relative relations, one is not to prove ‘I am correct’. One has to bring about a closure by saying, ‘you are correct’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: belief, insistence, real-relation, relation, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Everybody knows basically what is right and what is wrong. Everybody knows better than to hate others. In fact, most people teach against it, and yet we still see it on the daily. But why do you think that is? It is because the problem was never really humans not loving humans enough; the problem was humans not loving righteousness enough. We must empty our own love for the world so that it can be replaced by the love of Christ; only then will we begin to love people as Christ loves people, as He always intended.
author: Criss Jami
tags: apologetics, christ, conscience, divine-love, god, happiness, hate, holiness, humans, hypocrisy, joy, love, love-of-god, morals, peace, right, righteousness, sacrifice, self-sacrifice, spiritual, true-love, truth, virtue, world, wrong

quote: Doost", Ahmed voiced. "Doost",he repeated softly,shutting his eyes.The word felt like a caress."what does it mean?"'It means "The Friend","The One I Love","the One I Long For".
author: Muriel Maufroy, Rumi's Daughter
tags: beautiful, book, dost, inspirational, life, love, mystical, spiritual

quote: There is no Gnan (True Knowledge) where there is ‘egoism’ and where there is Gnan, there is no ‘egoism’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, egoism, gnan, gyan, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: For what the Spirit sees becomes a truthAnd what the soul imagines is made a world
author: Sri Aurobindo
tags: inspirational, spiritual

quote: Someone may have a broken heart or someone may have a broken ego. Such people will have to suffer tremendously because of that.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, egoism, heart, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When the whirlpool of thoughts is going on; that is known as the mind. At that time, the mind is functioning independently. That and the vrutis (tendencies of the chit) have no relationship. The tendencies arise later on, and then they go back and forth.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, viruti, vrutis

quote: How can the thoughts be stopped? Tell the thoughts, ‘You take care of your own issues; I am not on your side.’ That way you will sit on God’s side.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: god, mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-god, thoughts

quote: One binds the worldly life with bad thoughts
author: one binds the worldly life with good thoughts. With the absence of thoughts (avichaar) there is moksha [liberation].
tags: Dada Bhagwan

quote: The mind that does inner intentions (bhaav-mann) is the ‘charge’ mind. The mind that is getting exhausted (dravya-mann) is the ‘discharge’ mind. Bhaav-mann creates the worldly life. Dravya-mann brings an end to the worldly life. When egoism goes away, bhaav-mann vanishes.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: bhaav, bhav, dravya, ego, egoism, intentions, maan, mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What does the world teach you? It teaches you (to do) egoism. Then, from that egoism, arise many many phases!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, egoism, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The chit is semi-animate (half-alive) and the mind is completely physical.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What is the value of the Gnani’s [the enlightened one’s] feet? It is a value that is immeasurable. The Gnani’s feet is one & the only solvent to dissolve egoism.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, egoism, enlighten, enlightened, gnani, gnani-purush, gyani, lotus-feet, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As long as there is the egoism of ‘I-ness’ (hoonpanu) and the partiality towards ‘my-ness’ (marapanu), how can there be liberation till then?
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, egoism, liberation, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: In reality, the outer instruments (hands, feet, eyes, etc) are not the hindrance (for liberation); it is the inner instrument (mind, intellect, chit and ego) that is obstructive.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, egoism, intellect, liberation, mind, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If you say a word against a ‘sensitive’ person, it will have an immediate effect. In reality, words are simply a ‘record’ playing.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, egoism, past-life, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, word, words

quote: Sometimes answers come to you in ways that only you can understand. That is why it is so important to have a clear mind to receive and understand the message.
author: Sheila M. Burke, Enriched Heart: The Tao of Balancing Your Big, Beautiful, Badass Soul
tags: answers, clear-mind, mind, spiritual

quote: A thinking puppet is the mind of life: Its choice is the work of elemental strengths That know not their own birth and end and cause And glimpse not the immense intent they serve. In this nether life of man drab-hued and dull, Yet filled with poignant small ignoble things, The conscious Doll is pushed a hundred ways And feels the push but not the hands that drive. For none can see the masked ironic troupe To whom our figure-selves are marionettes, Our deeds unwitting movements in their grasp, Our passionate strife an entertainment’s scene.
author: Sri Aurobindo, Savitri: A Legend and a Symbol
tags: inspirational, spiritual

quote: Money is energy and in the right hands can help heal the world.
author: Nikki Rowe
tags: energy, heal-the-world, healer, money, perspective, spiritual, success, world-peace

quote: Getting rid of the wrong understanding and attaining the right understanding is indeed bliss.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: bliss, bliss-definition, define-bliss, meaning-of-bliss, right-understanding, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, who-am-i

quote: The spirit of the way is surely there, in the wish to wander through the world in order to escape it and to find others where there is nobody.
author: Jean-Christophe Rufin, The Santiago Pilgrimage: Walking the Immortal Way
tags: escape, spiritual, travel, walking

quote: Life can only be live with grace, gratitude and generosity.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita
tags: giving, life, living, spiritual

quote: I didn't lose anyone, for everyone that I lost was never really a loss, unless it was death well then I had to have words with God.
author: Nikki Rowe
tags: awake, awakening, awareness, god, growth, higher-conciousness, higher-self, inner-knowing, inspire, lessons, mind, mindful, perspective, raw, real, spiritual, truth, wisdom

quote: What is the difference between disrespect (avinay) and despise (viradhana)? Disrespect (avinay) means one shows lack of respect and to despise (viradhana) means one becomes an adversary (opponent).
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: adversary, despise, disrespect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Not to be able to find one’s ‘own’ faults
author: this is called the world.
tags: Dada Bhagwan

quote: Flaw laden intellect shows faults in others. If you deviate even slightly in the wrong direction, you will see everyone at fault.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: fault, faults, intellect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: To be able to see one’s own faults
author: this is known as Enlightened vision (Samkit
tags: Self-realization

quote: Religion [dharma] is that where there is no irreligion (adharma, immorality). Religion cannot exist where there is irreligion. There can be only one or the other. Behind every intention, there is either [the force of] religion or [the force of] irreligion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: adharma, dharma, immoral, immorality, intention, irreligion, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Gnani Purush’ [the enlightened one] has the [knowledge of the-Self] essence of all religions.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: essence-of-all-religions, gnan, gnani, gnani-purush, gyani, knowledge-of-self, religion, religions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-enlightened-one

quote: One becomes bad himself when he sees or calls others bad. When others appear good to him, he will become good himself.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: bad, good, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If you praise the virtues of the person who is two degrees higher than you, if you worship him, if you serve him; this is known as aradhana (veneration; worship). If you say bad things about him, defame him; it is known as viradhana (despise). Viradhana (despise) results in your down fall and aradhana (worship) results in your rise upwards.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: aradhana, defame, despise, praise, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, veneration, virtue, virtues, worship

quote: To see others’ faults is a terrible mistake!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: faults, mistake, seeing-faults, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What is the difference between aradhana (worship) and bhajana (to be one with)? Aradhana (worship) means the attention will go over and over again there, and bhajana (oneness) means continuous engrossment. One is to do aradhana (worship) and bhajana (oneness) for only one’s own Self; everything else will carry on naturally.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: aradhana, bhajana, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, self, self-realisation, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-self, worship

quote: All day long, no one is at fault for anything. Whatever faults we see; we see them because of our own defects.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: defects, fault, faults, seeing-faults, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Despise (viradhana) of a Gnani [the enlightened one] creates hindrance in (acquiring right) Knowledge-Vision-Conduct (Gnan-Darshan-Charitra).
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: charitra, darshan, despise, enlightened-one, gnan, gnani, gyan, gyani, right-conduct, right-knowledge, right-vision, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One will bother you only if you have a karmic account with him. No one can bother you without your signature (karmic cause). All this is due solely to your signature.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: karma, karmic-account, karmic-cause, karmic-effect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The person performing the experiment becomes the object of the experiment himself
author: this is known as the illusion!
tags: Dada Bhagwan

quote: To worship means to go higher. If you join the one who has gone higher, you will go higher and if you speak ill of that person, you will fall down.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: humble, humbleness, humility, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worship

quote: In this world, it is not worth finding anyone’s faults. One becomes bound (by karma) by finding faults.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, fault, faults, karma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There's three different kinds of Christian," said Cash. "There's preaching Christians, church-playing Christians, and then there's practicing Christian. I'm trying very hard to be a practicing Christian.
author: Steve Turner
tags: biography, johnny-cash, spiritual

quote: The way in which the twists were entangled to knot up the mind-speech-body and the innate nature (relative self, prakruti), is the manner in which they will be untwisted.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: body, entangle, innate-nature, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, manner, mind, prakruti, relative-self, self, speech, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One gets recurrent thoughts about things he had insisted upon and about matters he formed opinions!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, form-an-opinion, insist, insistence, opinion, opinions, recurrent-thoughts, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, thougths, to-form-an-opinion

quote: Physical pleasures are not associated with attachment-abhorrence
author: the belief in an opinion itself is attachment-abhorrence.
tags: Dada Bhagwan

quote: Once an opinion is formed, there will be attachment-abhorrence. A person without opinion is also without attachment-abhorrence.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: abhorrence, attachment, opinion, opinions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One can give ‘correct’ opinion only if one has an open mind.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: correct, open-mind, open-minded, open-minds, openmind, openminded, opinions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Prakruti [the relative self, innate nature] has opinions and may store them but we should stay in an opinion-free state. ‘We’ are separate and the relative self is separate from us. ‘We’ should play our part as a separate entity. We shouldn’t get involved with those problems.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: abhorrence, attachment, belief, innate-nature, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, nature, opinion, opinions, prakruti, self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Quarrels and differences of opinions are solely due to a flawed-vision.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: conflicts, difference-of-opinion, differences-of-opinion, opinion, opinions, quarrel, quarreling, quarrels, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When one sees his own faults, he will not have the time to see the others’ faults.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: fault, faults, self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-self

quote: All this has been created from self-fault and self-imagination!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: fault, faults, self-imagination, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: This is one place an opinion has to be made: that this body is a betrayal.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: knowledge-of-the-self, knowlegde-of-self, opinion, opinions, self-realisation, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, who-am-i

quote: One should become free of mistakes so that there will be no superior over him.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: fault, faults, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Where there is love, there are no faults. Where the love of give-and-take (dealer) arose, all faults will be seen there.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: fault, faults, give-and-take, love, no-fault, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: God predestined His chosen people.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita
tags: god, motivational, people, saved-souls, spiritual

quote: As many opinions you bound about a person, if you let go of them, you will attain a natural state. For whomever and for whatever matter, you have bound opinions, those opinions will continue to sting you and when you let go of those opinions, you can become natural.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, natural, natural-state, opinion, opinions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Heaven is thine and so it's mine. Elated, I cannot give to thee but receive it sublime. And if it's there to shine for all to see,.. Vast sea of love for us to seize. Ease the pain with a sweet kiss, water the Flowers...No shadows of a perfect bliss but the sunshine of ours.
author: Ana Claudia Antunes, ACross Tic
tags: bliss, ease-of-mind, elated, elation, heaven, love, loving, rays-of-light, spiritual, sublime, sublime-love, sunshine

quote: Love is the bridge between the earth and the spiritual.
author: Grace Sara, Awakening in the 21st Century: Surviving a Spiritually Dormant Society
tags: awakening, earth, human-beings, inspirational, love, love-quotes, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Being dependent on this world will lead to betrayal. It will deceive us at the right time. It is better to depend on a pillow
author: at least it will not move away from us at the right time. The one that is living will move away.
tags: Dada Bhagwan

quote: Where there is insistence, there is tenacity and where there is tenacity, there is anguish.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: anguish, insist, insistence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tenacity

quote: Joy is our native conditionLet go all non-joy and there is joy
author: Ulf Wolf
tags: inspirational, joy, spiritual

quote: God had said to listen to what five people tell you and don’t hold on to your own opinion. The person who holds on to his opinion is isolated. If you insist upon it, it will harm you as well as others. This true-false is a relative truth; it is a mundane [worldly] truth. One should not insist upon it.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: god, harm, insist, insist-upon, isolated, isolation, opinion, real-truth, relative-truth, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, to-insist-upon, truth

quote: In this world, there is nothing that is right. Anything that people raise objection to, is wrong. Do people raise objection in every matter?
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: objection, raise-an-objection, raise-objection, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As long as there is insistence of the truth, one cannot know the Vitarag Lord [the enlightened one].
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: enlightened-one, insist, insistence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vitrag-lord

quote: Where there is insistence, there is worldly life.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: insist, insistence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worldly-life

quote: Where there is the slightest insistence, there is no religion there!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: insist, insistence, no-religion, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: God has said for us to know bad, as bad and good, as good. But while knowing the bad, there should not be the slightest abhorrence towards it and while knowing the good, there should not be slightest attachment towards it. Without knowing bad, as bad, the good cannot be known as good.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: adhorrence, attachment, bad, god, good, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-bad, the-good

quote: To be free of insistence [free of forcing one's own opinion] is the path of Vitragta [attachment-free state, the enlightened one]. Quit insisting at all places. To even insist on the truth, God has considered it as ignorance. There is no insistence in ‘Us’ whatsoever!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: attachment, enlightened-one, free-of-insistence, gnani-purush, god, ignorance, insist, opinion, path-of-vitragta, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, truth, vitrag

quote: Insistence on one’s own opinion can never lead to attainment of Moksha [Ultimate Liberation]. Only those who are free of insistence will attain Liberation.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: insist, liberation, moksh, moksha, opinion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, ultimate-liberation

quote: In Vitrag-Vignan [science of vitraag lords, the enlightened ones] there cannot be the slightest of the [wrong] insistence; moreover, there can be no insistence on one’s own opinion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: enlightened-one, insist, insistence, lord, opinion, own-opinion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, spiritual-science, vitrag, vitrag-lord, vitrag-vignan

quote: There should be no tenacity of insistence or obstinate insistence of any kind. If there is any tenacity, it should be the kind that will go away if you tell it to!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: insist, insistence, obstinacy, obstinate, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tenacity

quote: There is no truth in this world that is worth insisting upon! Anything that is insisted upon is not the truth at all!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: insist, insistence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, truth, worth

quote: The one, who does not have the ‘poison’ of insistence, will become free from all entanglements (karmic).
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: become-free, entanglements, insist, insistence, karma, karmic, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: My life of conversation leads me to reimagine the very meaning of hope. I define hope as distinct from optimism or idealism. It has nothing to do with wishing. It references reality at every turn and reveres truth. It lives open eyed and wholeheartedly with the darkness that is woven ineluctably into the light of life and sometimes seems to overcome it. Hope, like every virtue, is a choice that becomes a habit that becomes spiritual muscle memory.
author: Krista Tippett, Becoming Wise: An Inquiry into the Mystery and Art of Living
tags: art-of-living, enoughness, faith, habit, hope, on-being, religion, spirit, spiritual, truth, virtue, wholeheartedness

quote: Every human being needs security. The one, who does not have security, will be in fear. So he will look for security outside if he does not get it at home. The Gnani Purush [the enlightened one] is the only one who does not need any security. The Gnani is considered to be free from all dependency (niralamb). Others will take support from Him, but He will not take any support. Only the Gnani Purush can remain free from dependency in this world.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: dependency, enlightened-one, fear, gnani-purush, niralamb, no-security, security, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, support

quote: As long one is not able to let go of the insistence on a certain opinion [faith, sect], he has not earned the right for Moksha [Ultimate Liberation]. He is not worthy of Moksha if he is in the sect. He is only worthy of material happiness; he is worthy of a celestial life.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: celestial-life, faith, happiness, insistence, material-happiness, moksh, moksha, opinion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, ultimate-liberation

quote: It is only those who do not know who wander the paths. A blind eye and a stout heart create a true wanderer. Those who seek the paths do so in vain
author: only those who can see deep might hope to wander.
tags: Mary-Jean Harris, Wrestling with Gods

quote: If you walk around proudly when someone greets you with respect or says, ‘welcome, welcome’, you will suffer a loss, right? Here, it was the other person’s duty [social obligation] to welcome you, but you shouldn’t fall short. So you should immediately check your balance-sheet (of karma) to find out where you sustained a loss!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: karma, loss, obligation, proud, respect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: A person who has the slightest fear of insult cannot be called a “Gnani” [the enlightened one] and a person who desires self-recognition [maan] is not a Gnani [the enlightened one].
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: desires, ego, enlightened-one, fear, fear-of-insult, gnani, insult, maan, self-recognition, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One does not like insults yet ironically he is an expert in insulting others. How can this be called a human-behavior?
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: human-behavior, insult, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: A person with a large tuber of self-pride remains engrossed in the fear of, ‘Someone is going to insult me…someone is going to insult me’ or ‘From where can I get respect? From where can I get the respect?
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, fear, fear-of-insult, insult, pride, recognition, respect, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: After getting respect, one will get an equal amount of insult, if not in this life then the next. If you taste even the slightest of pleasure from this body-complex [pudgal], you will have to pay back an equivalent amount. Therefore become attachment-free (vitarag).
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: attachment, attachment-free, insult, life, pleasure, respect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vitarag

quote: The higher one sits, the greater the fear of fall.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, fear, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: It is a tremendous strength to be able to digest an insult.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: insult, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, strength, tremendous-strength

quote: How can you tell whether the ego is there or not? You will know when someone insults you. If someone insults you, swallow (accept) it with understanding.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, insult, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, swallow-the-insult

quote: If one knows how to ‘digest’ an insult after attaining Self-realization, he will become a ‘Gnani’ [the enlightened one]. And if he ‘digests’ an insult before attaining Self-realization, he will become shameless (impudent).
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: digest-an-insult, enlightened-one, gnani, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: To protect one’s own statement is the greatest form of violence. To impress upon others that his statement is correct is a form of violence itself.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: greatest-form-of-violence, greatest-violence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, violence

quote: Awareness’ will not arise where there is deceit along with self-pride (maan). If there is deceit with self-pride, then one can never see the self-pride.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: awareness, deceit, maan, pride, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What is arrogant pride (abhimaan)? It is to believe the weight of the body-complex [pudgal] to be one’s own weight. It is to believe that ‘I am Great’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: abhimaan, arrogant-pride, belief, great, i, i-am, i-am-great, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, wrong-belief

quote: Arrogant pride (abhimaan) means public display of self-pride (maan).
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: abhimaan, arrogant-pride, ego, maan, pride, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Self-serving-pride (swamaan) means to take precaution against being insulted.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: being-insulted, ego, insult, maan, pride, self-serving-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, swamaan

quote: He insulted me’ -this knowledge binds one with terrible demerit karma.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: bad-karma, demerit-karma, insult, karma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Your pride will be uprooted when a person who insults you appears to be your benefactor. The person who insults should be considered a benefactor, instead people get depressed when they are insulted.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: depressed, depression, ego, insult, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: In the worldly life, self-serving pride (swa-maan) is considered a good quality and arrogant pride (abhimaan) as a bad quality.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: abhimaan, arrogance, arrogant, good-quality, maan, pride, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, swamaan

quote: In the ignorant state, there is a ‘limit’ for good qualities, it is known as the self-pride. Self-serving pride (swa-maan) is the limit of virtues in the realm of ignorance.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: good-quality, ignorance, ignorant, maan, pride, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, swamaan, virtue

quote: In regards to maan (to seek importance from others), a man will become impudent if he keeps getting insulted up to a point. If he gets maan (importance from others) to a certain level, he grows stronger. And if he gets too much maan [praise], then his desire for it will come to end.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: desire, importance, insult, insults, maan, praise, respect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If one man gets excessive maan (importance from others) higher than a certain point, he will get tired of it, and if he gets excessive insults higher than a certain point, he gets agitated.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: agitated, agitation, insult, insults, maan, respect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One will become shameless if he does not fear insults in the worldly life. And in nischay [determination in the spiritual life] if one does not fear being insulted, he becomes independent.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: independent, insult, insults, nischay, shameless, spiritual, spiritual-life, spiritual-quotes, wordly-life

quote: One cannot have the same love for getting insulted (apmaan) as he does for getting importance (maan), can he? He cannot love loss as much as he loves profit, can he?
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: apmaan, importance, important, insult, insults, maan, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One has to attain an ego-less state (nir-ahankari)
author: attaining a nir-maani state (a desire-free state that wants importance from others) is not enough. The egoism one has of being nir-mani is very subtle. The external ‘horns’ are worn down but the internal ones still remain. The inner ‘horns’ will cause an internal biting.
tags: Dada Bhagwan

quote: Even if you insult him, he gives you his blessings; such a one only is the Gnani Purush [The enlightened one]!
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: bless, blessing, englightened-one, gnani-purush, insult, insults, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: For how long will insult hurt a person? For as long as he covets self-importance. For as long as one covets temporary [non eternal] things.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: arrogance, arrogant, ego, insult, self-importance, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There is no problem to relish pride when people praises you but at the same time, one must also be of the opinion that ‘this should not be so’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: ego, praise, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As long as man has pride, he will appear unattractive and no one will be attracted to him. He may have a handsome face, his pride makes him unattractive.
author: Dada Bhagwan
tags: appearance, attraction, attractive, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, unattractive

quote: Even the most aware of us do not realize the infinite power we possess or the magnitude of the ability we have to create, transmute, and transcend.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: consciousness, creation, creativity, empowerment, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, law-of-attraction, love, meditation, mind-body-spirit, mind-power, mindfulness, psychology, reality, spiritual, transcendence, transformation, universal, wisdom, zen

quote: When we are angry, when we are excited, when we are depressed, when we are elated, we are completely submerged in and identified with those thoughts and feelings. This is why we suffer. We suffer because we are completely identified with our thoughts and feelings and we think this is me. This is who I am.
author: Jetsunma Tenzin Palmo
tags: spiritual, suffering

quote: Ultimately, there is light and love and intelligence in this universe. And we are it, we carry that within us, its not just something out there, it is within us and this is what we are trying to re-connect with, our original light and love and intelligence.
author: Jetsunma Tenzin Palmo
tags: love, spiritual

quote: It is very possible to acknowledge another person’s concerns without entering into their vibration.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: communication, consciousness, empowerment, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, love, neutrality, psychology, relationships, self-esteem, spiritual, unattachment, vibration, wisdom, zen

quote: A single thought can shift your entire world.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: consciousness, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, law-of-attraction, love, mind, mindfulness, power-of-thoughts, psychology, self-esteem, self-help, self-improvement, spiritual, thoughts, thoughts-on-life, wisdom, zen

quote: To me sometimes a mute sky is more expressive than the roaring sea
author: Munia Khan
tags: expressive, feel, feelings, mute, muteness, nature, noiseless, ocean, philosophy, quiet, roaring, sea, sky, speechless, spiritual, vastness

quote: I’m not here to disagree with people or try to change anyone’s mind. I’m just here to accept and love others right where they are – no matter their belief systems or backgrounds.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: acceptance, consciousness, different-perspective, faith, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, kindness, learning, love, mindfulness, psychology, religion, spiritual, togetherness, unity, wisdom, zen

quote: I am not a victim of circumstance, situation, nor any external condition of life. I am an active participant in the creation of my reality, meaning, I am actively participating in the creation of what I think, what I feel, what I spend my time on, who I spend my time with, what I consume mentally and physically, and all the blessings and contrastive experiences that come my way. Every effect has a cause and every cause has an effect, all of which include me because it is my life to live, my life to use, and my life to enjoy.
author: Alaric Hutchinson
tags: consciousness, creation, daily-inspiration, empowerment, feelings, growth, happiness, inner-peace, inspirational, joy, law-of-attraction, mind-body-spirit, mindfulness, new-age, power, psychology, reality, self-improvement, spiritual, time, time-management, wisdom, zen

quote: For I do not seek to understand so that I may believe; but I believe so that I may understand. For I believe this also, that unless I believe, I shall not understand.
author: Anselm of Canterbury
tags: spiritual

quote: A ‘caring’ judgment is still a judgment. And any form of judgment creates blocks and stagnation.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: caring, caring-for-others, consciousness, energy, flow, giving, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, judgment, neutrality, new-age, psychology, spiritual, universal-truths, wisdom, zen

quote: With all control look for the hole, your mind gets weak, unless it’s truth you seek. Swirled and twirled into another world, into the smog, a doorway within the fog.” Deetkatu, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
tags: childrens-book-quotes, elemental-kingdom, faerie, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, mystical, natural-law, poetry-quotes, spiritual, universal-law

quote: If you say something over and over and over again you may just start to believe it. If you truly do believe it, you can be sure you will receive it."Selkie Anne, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
tags: childrens-book-quotes, elemental-kingdom, faerie, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, mystical, natural-law, spiritual, universal-law

quote: I guess we all know that more souls will advance.” When you learn that life can make you wise, it’s no surprise that the light within you will grow and will shine for those you come to know.”Benoway, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
tags: childrens-book-quotes, elemental-kingdom, faerie, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, mystical, natural-law, spiritual, universal-law

quote: OHHHH don’t make me cry, I’m a big strong guy, I can make you laugh and I’d never tell a lie, See my muscles on my legs when I swim, I can do back spins with the force of my fins. SOOOOO don’t make me cry, I’m a big strong guy, I can make you laugh and I’d never tell lie. The muscles in my heart are tougher than my shell, To “love” makes me stronger than to lift a barbell.”Willard the Sea Turtle, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
tags: childrens-book-quotes, elemental-kingdom, faerie, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, mystical, natural-law, spiritual, universal-law

quote: Do you not believe, Governess, where this power comes from, you seek? It is not from the “things” you keep. I trust the Creator to take care of me. Come what may, I will stay out of your way.”Trinity, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
tags: childrens-book-quotes, elemental-kingdom, faerie, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, mystical, natural-law, spiritual, universal-law

quote: Pretty things can be denied when it is beauty that comes from a place inside. Your outer appearance may have its place but to walk in beauty is to walk in grace. So lift your confidence to gain inner merit, then walk in beauty and connect to your spirit. Embellish yourself with art for fun, it enhances, inspires and in beauty, YOU RUN!"Maiara, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
tags: childrens-book-quotes, elemental-kingdom, faerie, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, mystical, natural-law, spiritual, universal-law

quote: Might I take this moment to give thanks to our loving Creator for supplying us with all our needs for this day and always!” Grampa Foster, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
tags: childrens-book-quotes, elemental-kingdom, faerie, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, mystical, natural-law, spiritual, universal-law

quote: Being in our secret place brings much peace and the more we go there, the more it will increase. Now we let it all go by, have faith in what we see and it IS what will be.”Gramma Tenanye, Meet the Little People…An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-book-quotes, elemental-kingdom, faerie, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, mystical, natural-law, spiritual, universal-law

quote: With natural law there is no flaw, we must act in truth and be smart.”Grampa Foster, Meet the Little People…An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-books-quotes, enchanting, faerie, fairy-tales, little-people, natural-law, poetry, spiritual, universal-law

quote: You mean to tell me that you have made a human friend? It could be dangerous and I must urge it to end! Deetkatu, where is your sense?” Grampa's tone was abruptly tense.Grampa Foster, Meet the Little People…An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-book-quotes, enchantment, fairy-tales, little-people, spiritual

quote: -- So this is the measure of your God's Mercy.-- No. This is the measure of Pharaoh's soul.
author: The NT Translation (Moses)
tags: spiritual

quote: Protect me from the fairies wild, Or exchange thee for a stolen child. A debt be paid more than a few, Tempting hunger with fairy stew. A mother’s distraction used as bait, To steal unchristen babes in wait. Malevolent fairies will deceive, Of lower nature and unbelief. An act to reflect the human soul, Will light the darkness of shadow. By living life of higher mind, A changeling thee will never find. In thy cradle a bundle of love, Your child protected by God above." Changelings, Meet the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: changeling, children-books-quote, enchanting, fairy-quotes, little-people, poetry, spiritual

quote: Sometimes humans just don't listen, they ‘take’ to fill a space that’s missin’!" Deetkatu, Meet the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-quotes, elemental-kingdom, fairy-tales, inspirational-quotes, little-people, spiritual

quote: Our traditions teach us the past is not forgot, yet the past repeats the future believe it or not. If we dwell on the negative, we continue to make, an unhealthy life we must never forsake. Our fairy ring teaches us cause and effect, what we give to the world, returns to us direct!”Chepi, Meet the Little People…An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-book-quotes, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, spiritual

quote: We do not want to deny existence. Yet we also do not want to limit existence. Thus, we observe and honor without forming opinion, labeling, or adding a story to the object of our observation.
author: Alaric Hutchinson
tags: buddhism, consciousness, existence, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, learning, letting-go, meditation, mind-body-spirit, mindfulness, psychology, spiritual, story, wisdom, zen

quote: Bad in good and good in bad, see the life you could have had? Your life is the keyhole, and you are the key, don’t look back, NOW choose to be happy!”Deetkatu, Meet the Little People…An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-book-quotes, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, spiritual

quote: Now Arthur, if humans could learn to gaze with their eyes or use their special sight, they would realize there is more to seeing than just what is in front of them!” Den the Wise Oak Tree, Meet the Little People…An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-book-quotes, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, spiritual

quote: A boy was regarded King to be, in a land only a child could see. We admit it could be a difficult task, just in case you are inclined to ask, for those who would even vaguely begin, to remember the child that comes from within, of a modern world still hardened by past and rules that can make you grow up fast. Yet into the imagination, we hope you escape, from beliefs that your life may potentially shape; try to let go of what you normally resist, while exploring the way nature and a boy co-exist.
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-book-quotes, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, spiritual

quote: My head says forget it, my heart says I’ll regret it, and what my stomach tells me, I should not ignore. Oh no, I gotta go, give me a leave, not your sleeve! I know this will cease, when I feel peace. So I will help a boy, come to Joy, a risk I shall take, it’s no mistake, my stomach tells me so.” Deetkatu, Meet the Little People…An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-book-quotes, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, spiritual

quote: When you are open and aware, it allows for all magical possibilities! We, here in the forest, can see all that goes on in our environment on the surface; but we have true awareness that sees beyond the shallow! This belief comes from the depths of wisdom that there is more than meets the eyes!”Den the Wise Oak Tree, Meet the Little People…An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure
tags: childrens-book-quotes, fairy-tales, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, little-people, spiritual

quote: Pain is inevitable, yet suffering is optional. It is our heart connections that make all the difference. When we experience mental, physical, emotional, or spiritual pain – love is the one medicine that transcends any synthetic or organic drug we use to suppress pain.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: acceptance, consciousness, emotions, forgiveness, growth, healing, heartache, heartbreak, humble-yourself, humbleness, inner-peace, inspirational, inspirational-love, kindness, love, meditation, mindfulness, open-heart, open-mind, pain, psychology, self-awareness, spirit, spiritual, strength, wisdom, zen

quote: What is your heart worth to you? The answer is ‘everything’. Our hearts are worth the World.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: acceptance, consciousness, everything, growth, heart, heartwarming, inner-peace, inspirational, inspirational-love, love, meditation, new-age, open-heart, open-mind, psychology, self-love, spiritual, trustworthy, wisdom, world-peace, worthiness, zen

quote: Good… Bad? I’m not here to judge where you’re at or where you’ve been. I’m simply here to encourage you in where you would like to go. You have the map; I’ll shine the light on it so you can better read it. And eventually, the sun will rise again in your life and you’ll no longer need my light to assist you.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: assistance, consciousness, counseling, direction, friendship, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, joyful-living, light, maps, psychology, relationships, self-help, self-improvement, spiritual, sunrise, sunshine, transformation, wisdom, zen

quote: The Law of Attraction takes into account all of your doubts. So, if you say you practice the Law of Attraction yet always carry an extra parachute with a Plan B, C, & D for those ‘just in case’ scenarios… you may be tricking yourself into believing that you believe when, in actuality, you are quite insecure. If you always have a backup plan ready – though it may come off as ‘prepared’ and ‘smart’ – it also implies that you do not fully trust that Spirit will always provide.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: abundance, allowing, confidence, consciousness, daily-life, faith, faith-in-action, faith-in-yourself, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, law-of-attraction, new-age, psychology, spirit, spiritual, trust, wisdom, zen

quote: It’s important to have a vision of the long run and make wise decisions for our highest good in the present moment; however, we don’t want to become attached to how everything must look. When we show up in good faith, life provides. And when we trust, we are always in the flow of manifestation.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: acceptance, clarity, consciousness, energy, flow, growth, highest-good, inner-peace, inspirational, manifestation, present-moment, psychology, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: One man suffers to save many.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita
tags: faith, hardships, hope, jesus-christ, motivational, never-give-up, spiritual, suffering

quote: WE GROW IN SPIRIT WITH EACH LESSONLEARNED THROUGHEXPERIENCE...LET US BE THANKFULNO MATTER HOW PAINFULTHE LESSON!!!
author: Summerlyn Guthrie
tags: life, life-experience, life-lesson, life-lessons, life-philosophy, philosophy-quotes, spiritual, spiritual-growth

quote: :You Can overcome any obstacle. You can achieve the most tremendous things by faith power.
author: Norman Vincent Peale
tags: spiritual

quote: The sacrifices we make to stay healthy, to look good, the tasty foods we skip, the guilt trips, the exercising - all these things require great discipline, care, and even a paradoxical, self-denying self-love of sorts in order to be properly executed. However it is regretful that so many of us today are not as passionate about our spiritual holiness as we are about our physical health. They are indeed both important - we should worship in every aspect of our lives - and one even, in a sense, entails the other. Although, this disproportion in said priorities is still very much expected: we humans have always taken a liking to trendiness and the temporal side of things, doing what is judged vainly in the eyes of man before that which is judged vitally and eternally in the eyes of God (i.e. "cleaning the outside of one's cup while leaving a filthy inside"). But in a way, it all goes to show that the man who fully hates discipline hates himself fully; for within the spirit is where The Holy One judges true wellness or malady.
author: Criss Jami
tags: ailment, apologetics, body, care, death, dedication, diet, discipline, disease, disobedience, eating, eternal, exercise, food, fullness, god, guilt, health, holiness, malady, nutrition, obedience, paradox, physical, sacrifice, self-denial, self-help, self-love, sickness, spiritual, temporary, transformation, trendiness, vanity, wellness, worship

quote: There are those who feel that the world is ultimately moving closer to Truth and to prosperity as the times evolve; then there are those who feel that it is ultimately moving farther away from Truth and into self-destruction. From this, and if it were really that simplistic, one might get the impression that life gravitates slightly into two types of people whom which are diametrically opposed in spirit.
author: Criss Jami
tags: beliefs, conservative, destruction, devolve, dystopia, evolve, feelings, liberal, life, opinions, political, progression, prosperity, self-destruction, spiritual, theory, truth, utopia, world

quote: Yes, contrast teaches us a great many things and there is purpose for it. Yet it is time to transcend your everyday dramas that are but drops in an ocean. Cease focusing on your droplets of water and look around you. Everything you say and touch and do sets into motion ripples that either heal and create or curse and destroy. Let me repeat: Everything.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: consciousness, contrast, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, law-of-attraction, mindfulness, perspective, power-of-thoughts, power-of-words, psychology, purpose, spiritual, teaching, transcendence, wisdom, zen

quote: The Story Is Always ThereSometimes you don't need to talk to someone to see how they feel. You don't need to ask about their story. Some people have it written on their faces and you just have to take the time to read.
author: Delma Pryce, WATCH & PRAY:  ARE YOU READY
tags: accomplishments-quotes, grateful-heart, inspirational-quotes, love, loving-one-another, mankind-quotes, mentality, motivational, people-relations, people-skills, spiritual

quote: Are you able to remain humble and kind when things do not go the way you want or expect? Be kind when you are in pain; be kind even when your life seems to be falling apart around you. It is important to not only say and do the ‘right’ thing, it is important to also think and believe it - which is being genuine in nature of peace embodiment.

quote: When faced with contrast, take nothing personally and don’t try to defend yourself. Defending one’s self is a vibrational relative of guilt. People will think what they like; do not feed fuel to the fire by reacting. Simply ask questions for clarity and in response say ‘Is that so?’ Take responsibility for the energy you brought to the situation, acknowledge the illusions without attachment, and move forward. Other people’s opinions are none of your business. Remember that each person is on their own unique path, and the mirror of contrast you hold up to them may be exactly what is necessary for their conscious growth at that time.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: Laney, why do I believe you transcend the ordinary? Why do I look at you, and expect to see a façade fall away, revealing something much more than even the extraordinary? Tell me."Elaine flushed, her knees wobbling. “I…don’t…know. But thank you—for the kind words. I’m flattered.” She closed her eyes wanting to hide. He was too close…too beautiful…too fervid.And she was too vulnerable, too exposed.“Look at me.”She hesitantly met his unwavering gaze.“No more hiding in your shadows,” he whispered, “because I will find you. And I will drag you kicking and screaming back into the light, where you belong. Do you understand?”“Yes."“Good.” He took her hand and guided her forward.

It becomes part of our vibrational aura, what we’re emitting and receiving in return from the world. How we respond to the world is how the world will treat us.

quote: Close your eyes and trust; go in the direction of what makes you feel authentically lighter and brighter. There is no good or bad. Retribution feels vibrationally better than desperation. It’s better than sitting still because your energy has movement. Frustration is better than retribution, because now you’re not projecting negative energy outward, you’re processing it within. Apathy is better than frustration; at least you’ve reached some form of detachment. Optimism is better than apathy. Optimism becomes happiness. Co-creative inspiration follows… and then comes joy.

quote: Isn’t it funny how we make rational excuses for being out of alignment?	We say, “Well, this ____ and that ____ happened, so it makes perfect sense for me to be feeling like this ____ and wanting to do this ____.”	Yet, to this day, I have never met a happy person who adheres to those excuses. In fact, each time I – or anyone else – decide to give in to “rational excuses” that justify feeling bad – it’s interesting that only further suffering is the result.	There is never a good enough reason for us to be out of alignment with peace. Sure, we can go there and make choices that dim our lights… and that is fine; there certainly is purpose for it and the contrast gives us lessons to learn… yet if we’re aware of what we are doing and we’re ready to let go of the suffering – then why go there at all? It’s like beating a dead horse. Been there, done that… so why do we keep repeating it?	Pain is going to happen; it’s inevitable in this human experience, yet it is often so brief. When we make those excuses, what happens is: we pick up that pain and begin to carry it with us into the next day… and the next day… into next week… maybe next month… and some of us even carry it for years or to our graves!	Forgive, let it go! It is NOT worth it! It is NEVER worth it. There is never a good enough reason for us to pick up that pain and carry it with us. There is never a good enough reason for us to be out of alignment with peace. Unforgiveness hurts you; it hurts others, so why even go there? Why even promote pain? Why say painful things to yourself or others? Why think pain? Just let it go!	Whenever I look back on painful things or feel pain today, I know it is my EGO that drives me to “go there.” The EGO likes to have the last word, it likes to feel superior, it likes to make others feel less than in hopes that it will make itself (me) feel better about my insecurities. Maybe if I hurt them enough, they will feel the pain I felt over what they did to me. It’s only fair! It’s never my fault; it’s always someone else’s. There is a twisted sense of pleasure I get from feeling this way, and my EGO eats it right up. YET! With awareness that continues to grow and expand each day, I choose to not feed my pain (EGO) or even go there. I still feel it at times, of course, so I simply acknowledge it and then release it.	I HAVE power and choice over my speech and actions. I do not need to ever “go there” again. It’s my choice; it’s your choice. So it’s about damn time we start realizing this. We are not victims of our impulses or emotions; we have the power to control them, and so it’s time to stop acting like we don’t. It’s time to relinquish the excuses.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: consciousness, ego, emotions-and-attitude, forgive-yourself, forgiveness, growth, happiness, impulse, impulse-control, inner-peace, inspirational, intention, introspection, letting-go, moving-forward, moving-on, pain, power, psychology, releasing-the-past, self-control, self-development, self-discipline, self-improvement, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Like a sponge, we absorb, not liquid, but energy. Each morning we wake up as a fresh, dry sponge, ready to take in the world around us. Throughout the day, we interact with people, various energies, and a range of vibration. Each time, we absorb energy – either a small amount or a great deal – depending on whether the contact is direct or residual. And when we are filled to the point that we can absorb no more, we sometimes feel like we might explode. We know this bursting point – it reveals itself in our over-stimulated, over-stressed, near-crazy minds. Sleep often releases the energetic buildup, yet meditation works just as well. Meditation throughout the day “wrings out” our soggy, spongy selves. Deliberate mindfulness in the present moment can keep us from absorbing things we don’t resonate with, so that we no longer reach the point of mental breakdowns or emotional overloads.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: Your call to power is to slow down and reflect within. Gather the peace within yourself before you go out and act among the world. The feel good feeling that lasts is only achieved when you yourself know peace. Nothing is more powerful. This is why you have the highs and lows, the mood swings, the transcendent ecstasy followed by the crash. It is because you have yet to develop a foundation of peace for yourself that acts as an unmovable anchor in your life. Establish this peace in your life and you will experience a whole new reality of the world that flows with you in every way possible, rather than against you.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace
tags: consciousness, feelings, flow, going-with-the-flow, growth, heart, inner-peace, inspirational, peace, power, psychology, reality, reflection, self-improvement, self-realization, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Being under stress is like being stranded in a body of water. If you panic, it will cause you to flail around so that the water rushes into your lungs and creates further distress. Yet, by calmly collecting yourself and using controlled breathing you remain afloat with ease.

tags: breathing, calming-the-mind, calmness, consciousness, dealing-with-it, ease, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, love, panic, psychology, self-improvement, spiritual, stress, water, wisdom, zen

If they lived in the present moment, there would be no fear and they would walk forward in life with confidence and certainty that there is the joy of new experiences to be had.

quote: The actual, expanded consciousness, reality of our planet is that all of life is LOVE; our very existence is LOVE. Everything that exists is just varying degrees of this LOVE; polar absolutes do not exist. Good versus evil is pure illusion. Even the most seemingly “negative” person with ill intent is still in the spectrum of love.

quote: Our goal in life is to carry with us the wisdom of experience, yet treat each new day as its own unique reality, rather than comparing what currently is to what has been in the past. When we compare, we plant expectations that then become self-fulfilling prophesies through the Law of Attraction.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: God has called 'chit prasannta' (blissful state of chit) as happiness. Even when someone swears at you, picks your pocket; the 'chit prasannta' doesn’t go away! Even at two o’clock in the morning, the 'chit prasannta' does not go away.

tags: bliss, blissful-state, chit, happiness, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There are no places in this world where the chit can be concentrated. Without the chit attaining steady-state
author: the chit can’t be blissful. There are places where the mind can attain a steady state but there are no places where chit’s steady-state can be attained.
tags: Dada Bhagwan

quote: A place where the mind can attain stillness meaning doing darshan (seeing with the intent of worship) of a great person who has stillness of the mind, can still the mind of other person, however the chit is not steady there.

tags: chit, darshan, mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worship

quote: When the mind is steady, it will not create any vibrations, and therefore one will get the result. Along with that, if there is purity of chit, then one will surely be able to get his work done.

quote: Mind is indeed that which takes one to Moksha, and it is also the mind that makes one wander around in the worldly life. One needs to just turn it in the right direction. It had been turned in the wrong direction, and so it needs to be turned in the right direction.

tags: liberation, mind, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When people of different religions or countries harm people as a means to create peace, it’s out of the compulsion to make all colors the same. This is also why people think that war is a logical avenue towards creating peace. People who do not have or know inner peace perpetuate these shards of illusions. Thus, they are projecting their fragmented concepts of peace out onto the world.

quote: Detachment is being apathetic or aloof to other people, while un-attachment is acknowledging and honoring other people, while choosing not to let them influence your emotional well being. Detached would mean I do not care, while un-attached means I care, although I am not going to alter my emotional state due to your emotions, words, or actions.

quote: Never close the door of your heart to anyone. They may not be in vibrational alignment today, so you must place physical distance between you and them for your own well-being, but later in life, they may awaken and seek forgiveness, understanding, and peace. If you close the door to your heart, when they come seeking later on, they will find their way blocked and may walk away without knocking, since it took all the courage they had to just approach. Yet, if you leave the door open to your warm heart and they see that you are full of welcoming energy, co-creation will always be the reward, allowing you to make together a more beautiful world for all.

tags: alignment, consciousness, energy, family-relationships, forgiveness, growth, inner-peace, inspirational, moving-forward, moving-on, openness, psychology, spiritual, understanding, vibration, wisdom, zen
